articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were joined by Mario and Uri who gave us an overview of Sumer
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Mario is a software developer working at Sumer where he is building an observability tool for dapps. He got into web3 early in 2017 on the speculation side of things but quickly fell in love with the technology.
Uri a DevRel at Sumer holding a master's degree in cyber security. He got into the web3 space in 2020 on the speculation side of things; however, quickly fell in love with the technology after going straight down the rabbit hole.
🔥 About Sumer
From the Sumer Docs:
Sumer is the frictionless and powerful web3 Performance Monitoring tool that helps you to find bugs, prevent potential revenue losses and improve user experience.
Resources:
Website: https://www.getsumer.com/
Docs: https://docs.getsumer.com/sumer/
GitHub: https://github.com/getsumer
Twitter: https://twitter.com/getsumer
Mario's Twitter: https://twitter.com/zmariuz
Uri's Twitter: https://twitter.com/uri0x01

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j4GS5fuqhV8
articles.title: DevNTell - Sumer

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, Christopher Carfi (Head of Marketing, Unlock Protocol) gave us an overview of how we can use Unlock Protocol to build subscription memberships as NFTs
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Christopher Carfi is a community-builder, marketer & technologist exploring the intersection between creators, community, and business models related to NFTs, DAOs, and web3, and is Head of Marketing at Unlock Protocol. Prior to joining Unlock, Chris was at GoDaddy for nearly six years and headed up content and community efforts globally. During the course of his 20+ year career, Chris has worked in startups and big companies, and has developed marketing, customer community and evangelist programs for a number of brands you've heard of. He currently lives in the Bay Area with his family.
🔥 About Unlock Protocol
From the Unlock Protocol GitHub Repo:
Unlock is a membership protocol, built on a blockchain. It enables creators to monetize their content or software without relying on a middleman. It lets consumers manage all of their subscriptions in a consistent way, as well as earn discounts when they share the best content and applications they use.
Resources:
Presentation deck: https://t.co/jX6UGNxdZL
Unlock Protocol: https://unlock-protocol.com/
Developer Docs: https://t.co/NwlRWf29dI
Unlock Protocol video tutorials: https://t.co/I2M1k0DSlG
Unlock Protocol code examples & tutorials: https://t.co/JcSMAH6Rd8
GitHub: https://github.com/unlock-protocol/unlock
Unlock Protocol Blog: https://t.co/L976YXYDEf
Unlock Protocol Discord: https://t.co/QX1o4NoVve
Twitter: https://twitter.com/unlockprotocol
Christophers Twitter: https://twitter.com/ccarfi

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUkSgOhTsJo
articles.title: DevNTell - Subscription memberships with Unlock Protocol

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, Giancarlo gave us an overview of Webstudio: a drag-and-drop website 3.0 builder
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Giancarlo is a software engineer from Venezuela and founder of Webstudio, a no-code decentralized website builder. Giancarlo is passionate about bringing the benefits of Web 3.0 to the masses. Before Webstudio, he worked as a manager and engineer at Amazon, where he gained valuable experience in tech and leadership and had the privilege of working with outstanding folks. Before that, he was a founding engineer at Glofox, a fitness software company in Ireland. Giancarlo is excited to be a part of the Web3 space so that he can contribute to building a more decentralized and democratized Internet where people have more control over their data, finances, and ultimately their lives.
🔥 About Webstudio
Webstudio is a drag-and-drop website 3.0 builder featuring 250+ UI blocks and 10+ pre-built templates powered by TailwindCSS. Sites are deployed in the Interplanetary File System for resilient and tamper-proof, peer-to-peer sharing even in areas with slow or limited connectivity. Web3 native blocks make it easy to build applications that interact with EVM networks such as Ethereum or Polygon.
Resources:
Website: https://www.webstudio.so/
GitHub: https://github.com/webstudioso
Twitter: https://twitter.com/webstudioso
Giancarlo's Twitter: https://twitter.com/gianksp
Slides from the presentation: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/13YiBvNtvRABi9BkSf9lNjCfD-EGdrd7QbBvkYXp8kgI/edit?usp=sharing

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GSEFCVsWSxM
articles.title: DevNTell - Webstudio

articles.author: Naman Garg
articles.description:
Do you want to provide easy Web2-like onboarding to your Web3 app? Imagine if users don't need any wallets or funds to pay for gas fees and deal with complex transaction pop-ups to use your Web3 app 🤯
Biconomy's robust SDK uses account abstraction (EIP 4337) to provide various features. Be it by allowing users to make smart wallets with their Gmail account or by sending transactions with no pop-ups. It has helped countless DApps increase their users by 10x and existing "Web2" apps to provide Web3 features to their users. If you wish to do the same, follow this guide to learn the basics by building a demo DApp!
In this guide, I'll show you how to integrate Biconomy in your Web3 app to simplify UX by creating a simple message board decentralized application (DApp) where people can post anon…
articles.title: How to Integrate Biconomy Into Your DApp

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, Nico Burkart gave us an overview of Streamr Network
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Nico is a DevRel Engineer at Streamr and Data Union DAO. Nico, as with many other Developer DAO members, has a very inspiring story behind his journey into web3. Having sold all his possessions, Nico moved to Madeira to live the digital nomad life in pursuit of a career in web3. After some ups and downs, a brief stint as a web2 dishwasher API engineer and experiencing the wholesome community that is Developer DAO, Nico found his calling in web3 with Streamr Network.
🔥 About Streamr Network
From the Streamr Network documentation:
The Streamr Network is a peer-to-peer network for publishing and subscribing to data in real time. Applications use it for decentralized messaging, for example, sharing data across applications or broadcasting real-time state changes to large audiences. The decentralized nature of the system makes the data transport scalable, robust, secure, tamper proof, and censorship-resistant.
Resources:
Website: https://streamr.network/
Documentation: https://docs.streamr.network/
Streamr Developer Ambassador Program: https://share.hsforms.com/14jLAXgBLTBSaJBpqZMcV3A2lyqc
GitHub: https://github.com/streamr-dev/network
Nico's Twitter: https://twitter.com/nicoburkart
Streamr's Twitter: https://twitter.com/streamr

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWzcd6z8uaM
articles.title: DevNTell - Streamr Network
